title: Fake News: There is NO Secret Color Code On Toothpaste Tubes | Lead Stories
subtitle: Is there a secret color code hidden on the ends of toothpaste tubes that tells you if it the toothpase...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Is there a secret color code hidden on the ends of toothpaste tubes that tells you if it the toothpase contains chemicals or other ingredients? No, that's not true: the colored squares or rectangles on toothpaste tubes are just a marking that is used by the machines used to fill toothpaste tubes, it has no relation to the composition or ingredients of the toothpaste.

It is never made exactly clear what "natural" and "chemical" mean in this context, and what kind of "medicine" is meant exactly. And that is because the entire thing is a hoax. Colgate has helpfully put up an article explaining what is really going on:

What Does the Toothpaste Color Code Mean? | Colgate® Oral Care Social media and the internet in general can be full of useful information. However, it can be just as easy to come upon stuff that's completely made up. One hoax that has been making the rounds has to do with toothpaste and the colorful markings you see on the bottoms of the tubes.

The reason for the marks has to do with how toothpaste tubes are made. The marks help light sensors detect the end of the tube, so that the machines used to prepare the tubes knows where to cut or seal them.
